page.title: 01LANDSCAPE,WARWICKSLAND,POSN.
page.content: Area lies in two N-S low ridges with two N-S running valleys near to Scottish Border.The E ridge is forested and has rough grassland, improving into grazing land to the S. To th W,ashallow,broad valley descends where there is a stream or burn.Mainly grazing land with smaller areas of planted coniferous woodland.Further W the lower ridge is similar,being used for stock rearing and woodland.On the W border is Liddel Water. Throughout the area there is a mixture of grassland,rough pasture with deciduous and coniferous woodland.Some owned by the Forestry Commission as part of Kershope Forest.Variety of houses,built mainly of traditional local sandstone,brick and timber.Scattered community with a church,school,P.O/shop,Public Hall,2 pubs ,houses,bungalows and farmhouses.
